name: Norse Mythology
relatedConcepts: Olympians - Greek sky gods of order
Devas - Hindu gods of light and order
Tuatha De Danann - Celtic divine race
Sky Gods - Divine rulers of heaven
Divine War - Conflicts among the gods
Cosmic Order - Gods of structure and law
Thor - Protector god of the Aesir
Ragnarok - The fate of the Aesir

philosophicalMeaning.cyclicalCosmos: Universe operates in eternal cycles of destruction and renewal, not linear progression
philosophicalMeaning.heroicFatalism: True heroism is fighting bravely despite knowing defeat is certain
philosophicalMeaning.inescapableFate: Even gods cannot escape wyrd (fate) - acknowledging limits of power

name: Ragnarok
significance: Embodies Norse warrior ethos - courage in face of inevitable doom
Cyclical time concept vs. linear eschatology
Gods shown as mortal, vulnerable, subject to fate
description: Ragnarok (Twilight of the Gods) is the prophesied apocalyptic event in Norse mythology when the cosmos will be destroyed and renewed. It represents the Norse understanding of cyclical time and the heroic ideal of facing doom with courage.
relatedConcepts: Valhalla - Training ground for final battle
